intro: Caryospermum serrulatum, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its serrated leaf margins and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Caryospermum serrulatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
